intro: Polyosma apoensis, commonly known as the Philippine wild tea, is a shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by yellowish-orange fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
